source: Search – Based on Google Search for LinkedIn & GitHub Personal Branding Tips

search_platform.name: Google Search
keywords: how to write LinkedIn summary for freshers

level_1: Students use Google to find real LinkedIn profile examples.
Search shows what a good photo, bio, and headline look like.
They learn how to write clear summaries using samples.
Google results give step-by-step tips for freshers.
This module connects these searches with real practice.
level_2: Students search how to link GitHub repos to LinkedIn.
Results explain what to add in the Featured section.
Search helps find good GitHub README samples.
They see how top profiles show real projects.
This helps students polish both platforms together.
level_3: Students find ideas for posts and blogs.
Search shows how to share open source work publicly.
They find tips to grow connections fast.
Results explain using hashtags for reach.
This helps them build trust and stay active.
level_4: Students search how seniors guide juniors online.
They read case studies about thought leadership.
Search shows how to start a dev blog or newsletter.
They find tips for speaking at tech meetups.
This module shows how to stay visible long term.
